Fun with Vercel
2021-02-07

Vercel

Last week I wrote about First Steps Using Cloudflare Pages. That included a comparison with GitHub Pages and also talked about Netlify.

Vercel is another interesting participant in the trend toward static hosting, preview builds, serverless, and edge compute.

jldec.fun ü§™

This is a walkthough of deploying jldec.fun with Vercel. Markdown source files live on GitHub.

The Vercel signup starts a New Project workflow (which could be simplified.) üòÅ

Choose the first option in the dropdown.

This leads to the GitHub form for granting repo access to the 'Vercel' GitHub app. (Look for it later in your GitHub Settings to add more repos, or to revoke access.)

Back on Vercel, select a repo, and confirm the project scope. Team scope requires a paid plan.

Select the project directory within the repo - usually this will be the root.

The project name defaults to the name of the repo. I configured a build command and the output directory. I didn't really want encrypted environment variables here, so I made a note to go back to change this setting later.

Submitting the form, triggered the first build followed by a confetti shower. üéâ

I fixed the environment variables in the dashboard.

When I added my domain, the form helpfully recommended configuring an IP address.

Once the DNS record was in place, the invalid configuration was resolved.

jldec.fun is deployed from main. Commits to any other branch will trigger a preview deployment on a different URL.

Static websites are awesome!
